before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"jdg3","text":"Ensure Bench Cleanliness: Prior to starting the protocol, thoroughly sanitize lab bench and instruments. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3prco","text":"Optimized protocol for efficient extraction of HMW gDNA from the polysaccharide-rich microalga Botryococcus, enabling long-read sequencing on the Oxford Nanopore Technologies platform. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":95,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

documents.ofn: HMW gDNA PLOS ONE S1 File.pdf

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"97t0","text":"Maintain Frozen Samples: It is crucial to keep samples frozen during maceration using liquid nitrogen. Prepare sterile mortar, pestle, and spatulas for this step. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90beo","text":"Handle Homogenization with Care: Exercise caution with the use of liquid nitrogen during maceration and sampling preparation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19mjb","text":"Optimize Polysaccharide Removal: For effective polysaccharide removal with minimal DNA damage, keep the sonication step prior to cell lysis brief and at a low power setting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2b9p5","text":"Monitor Pellet Size: After each sorbitol wash step, check for an increase in pellet size. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6sk2q","text":"Buffer Preparation: Prepare and sterilize buffers in advance to streamline the process. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gjls","text":"Warm DNA Extraction Buffer: Warm the DNA extraction buffer to 65°C for at least 5 minutes before use for optimal results. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: high molecular weight DNA,Botryococcus braunii,long-read sequencing
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ld3p","text":"A. Buffer preparation ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6g2e","text":"1. Sorbitol wash buffer. Autoclave and store this buffer at 4°C for no more than six months. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"807l2","text":"• 100 mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3je9u","text":"• 0.35 M Sorbitol ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eli7v","text":"• 5 mM EDTA pH 8.0 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2r5tk","text":"• 1 % (W/V) Polyvinylpyrrolidone molecular weight 40,000 (PVP-40) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnh89","text":"• 1% (V/V) 2-Mercaptoethanol (β-ME). Note: Add after autoclaving and before use. It is best to aliquot the amount of buffer needed and add β-ME to this aliquot. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6d4n1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pna0","text":"2. DNA extraction buffer. Autoclave and store this buffer at room temperature for no more than six months. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"981lb","text":"• 100 mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8c13","text":"• 3M NaCl ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ae8dc","text":"• 3% CTAB ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adqm6","text":"• 20 mM EDTA ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29t2l","text":"• 1% (W/V) Polyvinylpyrrolidone ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"p45n","text":"• 1% (V/V) 2-Mercaptoethanol (β-ME). Note: Add after autoclaving and before use. It is best to aliquot the amount of buffer needed and add β-ME to this aliquot. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ouv1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8ku5","text":"3. 24:1 CHCl3/IAA buffer. Store this buffer at 4°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"10k2","text":"• 96 ml Chloroform ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31keb","text":"• 4 ml Isoamyl Alcohol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8k84o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cglda","text":"4. 3M Sodium acetate buffer ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9nq3b","text":"• 408.3 g sodium acetate ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"j81k","text":"• 3H2O per L ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90ref","text":"• pH to 5.2 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vghi","text":"• autoclave ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2butd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4o71c","text":"5. 1x TE (Tris EDTA) Buffer ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"574ek","text":"• 1mM EDTA, pH 8.0 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32kip","text":"• 10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vini","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5e91q","text":"B. Culturing Botryococcus culturing ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36},{"style":"italic","offset":13,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6i9fv","text":"• Culture Botryococcus species of choice in 1 L roux flasks with 750 ml modified Chu 13 medium, pH 7.5. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":10,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lp3n","text":"• Maintain at 22°C under continuous aeration with 2.5% CO2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70lat","text":"• Grow cultures for 6 weeks under a 12 h light:12 h dark cycle using 13 W compact fluorescent 65 K lighting at an intensity of 280 μmol photons/m2/s. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e33rs","text":"Biomass preparation ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cst3b","text":"• Harvest the biomass by filtration using a 10 μm nylon net.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eeb45","text":"• Add 1 ml sorbitol wash buffer to 1.5 ml eppendorf tube containing ~100 mg ground biomass. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9lgf9","text":"• Allow sample to thaw while vortexing for 10 seconds ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ej0ai","text":"• Keep samples on ice and sonicate for 25 seconds at 30% of power. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jivv","text":"• Centrifuge at 2,500 x g for 5 minutes at room temperature. Discard the liquid phase by aspiration or decanting. Save the pelleted and floating biomass. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":24,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12g2e","text":"• Repeat the biomass pre-wash step three times. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ansau","text":"• Add 700 μl DNA extraction buffer pre-warmed to 65°C, homogenize by vortexing for 10 seconds. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"635or","text":"• Incubate at 65°C for 30 minutes mixing by inversion every 10 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mucf","text":"• Incubate samples at room temperature for 5 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1dq5h","text":"• Add 700 μl CHCl3:IAA buffer, vortex for 10 seconds, and centrifuge at 2,500 x g for 10 minutes at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":80,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8tlui","text":"• Carefully transfer the upper aqueous phase (approximately 500 μl) to a new 1.5 ml eppendorf tube and keep on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bp5pa","text":"• Place small amount of frozen biomass into mortar and pestle with liquid nitrogen. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bm6a0","text":"• Grind biomass until a fine powder is formed, keeping frozen at all times. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcmm3","text":"• Weigh out ~100 mg aliquots, pace in 1.5 ml eppendorf tube, and store at -80℃. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ip82","text":"• Collect small amounts of biomass from the mesh using a rubber spatula and immediately freeze by placing in a 50 ml Falcon tube containing liquid nitrogen. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"53ci2","text":"• Repeat until all biomass is collected into a single Falcom tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fq7sn","text":"• Store at -80℃ until needed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"755en","text":"•  Add 2 μl RNase A (25 mg/ml), and incubate at 37°C for 15 minutes mixing by inversion every 5 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aa78g","text":"• Add 500 μl CHCl3:IAA buffer, vortex 5 seconds, and centrifuge at 13,000 x g for 10 minutes at 4°C. • Transfer the upper phase to a new 1.5 ml eppendorf tube and keep on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":76,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"kaha","text":"• Precipitate the HMW gDNA by adding 0.1 volumes of 3M sodium acetate pH 5.2 and 0.66 volumes of cold (-20°C) isopropanol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dngr5","text":"• Incubate samples overnight at -20°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7002r","text":"• Centrifuge at 13,000 x g for 10 minutes at 4°C, and discard supernatant by aspiration or decanting. • Dry pellet by resting inverted on paper towels at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":25,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7kl8t","text":"• Wash dried pellets with 1 ml of 70% ethanol and invert several times. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"324qn","text":"• Centrifuge at 13,000 x g for 10 min at 4°C. Remove the supernatant by aspiration to avoid pellet disturbance. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":25,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6q1ft","text":"• Dry samples in a vacuum centrifuge for 10 min at 36°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3s2d7","text":"• Resuspend HMW gDNA by adding 100 μl 1x TE buffer. Incubate at room temperature for 10 min then gently homogenize by inversion. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3jm61","text":"• Avoid pipetting that will shear the DNA. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fookr","text":"• Store at -80°C until needed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: Qualitative and quantitative analysis of HMW gDNA
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dfkkc","text":"1. Qualitative analysis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":25,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3iap","text":"• Analyze 200 ng of HMW gDNA by electrophoresis using a 0.5% agarose gel in 1x TAE buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14r6i","text":"• Carry out electrophoresis for 15 min at 120 volts and visualize with UV transilluminator. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8siq2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"am55u","text":"2. Quantitative analysis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":1,"length":25,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6a574","text":"• Measure absorbance at 230 nm (polysaccharides), 260 nm (nucleotides), and 280 nm (protein) using a UV-VIS spectrophotometer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dif7","text":"• Calculate DNA concentration using the A260 reading. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7r95","text":"• Calculate the A260/A280 and A260/A230 ratios to estimate protein and polysaccharide contaminations, respectively. Ratio values of 1.8 or higher are preferred. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: HMW gDNA purification proto
